data.title: Git Sidebar Filters and Sorting
data.body: Forgive if this is already submitted but I couldn't find a similar ticket when I searched the issues. I love the Git integration in VSCode but what do you think about add filters to the Git Sidebar? My thought is that you have toggle buttons for different Git Statues (Added, Modified, Deleted, Confict) and then an input field that allows you to filter the list. This would make large amounts of changes such as those in a merge conflict so much easier to deal with it and finding the right file.

data.title: Allow to diff 2 files in VS Code with command line arguments
data.body:
Thinking of the following syntax that would open a new window with the 2 files diffed:

`code --diff <file1> <file2>`

data.title: [feature request] mark errors in gutter

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: _From @koulmomo on February 24, 2016 23:37_ It would be good if the extension would mark the line at which errors occur along with **JUST** where it exactly occurs (this could just be a mark in the gutter at the line the error occurs). This would make it easier to quickly scan through files. Current: ![screen shot 2016-02-24 at 3 33 41 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/983861/13304835/0b1d6436-db0c-11e5-9e9b-f259b464f353.png) Suggested (taken from sublime): _Copied from original issue: Microsoft/vscode-eslint#33_

data.title: Space in anonymous function when formatting JavaScript code
data.body:
Version 0.10.10

In previous versions formatting was adding space in anonymous function like this:

```
function() {}
```

Became:

```
function () {}
```

Now it works vice versa. Is there any way to configure it?

data.title: 'Please consider to open a bug' should have an action with a link to github
data.body: The current notification 'Please consider to open a bug' that shows for instance when typescript crashes should have an action with a link to our GitHub issues. This would make it easier for the users to file bugs to us, not all our users know we are on git hub

data.title: [folding] add the possibility to always show the fold/unfold indicator

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: I think there should be a triple state value instead of a boolean in the settings.json. So one can choose between don't show folding, show folding on hover and alwasy show folding.

data.title: Define source for diagnostics that come from Salsa
data.body:
For JavaScript we are recommending to use a linter like ESLint for validation. This means our users will be confronted from error messages from both ESLint and the built-in Salsa validator. Error messages from ESLint have the `source` defined and they show up as `[ESLint] error msg`.

For consistency and to avoid confusion we should also set the source for diagnostics that come from the built in Salsa JS validation.  I suggest to use `JS` as the `source` label.

data.title: Revive javascript.validate.enable setting
data.body: When the setting is active then all diagnostics from Salsa for a .js file should be ignored.

Caused by https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/16a8d1d12fd2325eef98251f8c99e8f06c06dacb it seems

data.title: CSSnext & preCSS Support
data.body:
**Please add CSSnext & preCSS Support**
When using cssnext in combination with precss a lot of warning are given concerning expected braces or semicolons when nesting. This leads to a lot of red stripes and color theme being completely off.

**Configuration is:**
CSSnext (through PostCSS)
- PreCSS for Sass-like nesting

![schermafbeelding 2016-03-09 om 11 08 21](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12268407/13632110/71a41114-e5e8-11e5-9942-70b81461ad5b.png)

data.title: 'Run' action
data.body:
- [x] OS X @SofianHn 
- [x] Linux @joaomoreno 
- [x] Windows @dbaeumer 

for https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2780

In addition to debugging a program, VS Code now supports to 'Run' a program. 'Run' still starts a debug session in order to reuse functionality that makes sense in both modes, e.g. the 'Stop' button to terminate the program, or the debug console. But all debug controls like 'Step' or 'Pause' buttons are disabled.

The 'Run' action is always available but it only 'runs' a program for debug extensions that support it (as of March this are 'node', 'extensionHost', and 'mono'). If 'run' mode is not supported, the 'Run' action behaviour is identical to 'Debug'.
- Verify that 'Run' works as expected for node (and mono) programs as well as extensions.
- Verify that debug functionality is disabled in 'run' mode.

data.title: In 'Run without debugging' mode the Stop button must terminate the extension host
data.body:
Sending a disconnect request to the debug adapter is not enough because the debug adapter does not know the node process running the extension host and cannot kill it.

See #3904 for the corresponding API request.

data.title: Support to terminate extension host through IPC
data.body:
For the 'Run without debugging' we need a way to shut down the extension host when the user has pressed the debugger's Stop button.

see #3905 for the related UI item.

data.title: [js] syntax highlight for 'var' and 'function' not working in Default VS theme
data.body:
0.10.10 (Feburary build) has a regression is that the following JavaScript keywords are no longer highlighted in the Dark Visual Studio & Light Visual Studio themes:
`var` `let` `const` `function` `get` `set` `class` `interface` `module` `namespace`

This only affects JavaScript (not TypeScript).
The workaround if to switch to the Dark+ Default and Light+ theme.

Note that there are other colorizing issues open, not caused by this regression: e.g. 'import' and 'from'. See https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript-TmLanguage/issues/37

data.title: Beware on 1000 extensions limit in the gallery query
data.body: We will hit it soon

data.title: Assist users in setting up their jsconfig.json
data.body: Pre-Salsa the JS support has automatically excluded some folders from the project context. Now that Salsa is no longer doing this users run into issues (slow intellisense, crashes), We should assist and hint users to create a jsconfig.json with the proper excludes.

data.title: Include Code version number in download zip file name

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
That way you can tell at a glance which version you have without opening the zip file.

Also suggest don't talk about the "February release", "March release", etc. That's too imprecise.

data.title: [folding] sections are still folded when disabled in preferences
data.body:
Enable folding in preferences.
Fold section(s).
Disable folding in preferences.

Actual results:
Section(s) are still folded and cannot be unfolded because the section with fold/unfold symbols is hidden. Glyph(s) at the end of the folded section(s) first line is visible.

Expected results:
All sections unfolded and the section with fold/unfold symbols is hidden. Glyph(s) at the end of the first section(s) line should not be visible.

data.title: Not output paired quotation marks in php but javascript?
data.body:
In javascript, when I press `'`, a pair `''` outputed, and my cursor are in center `'|'`, but in php, just a single `'` output.

Is this expected or something wrong?

data.title: Output: avoid trimming if input is > MAX_OUTPUT_LINES
data.body:
An optimisation idea: If you receive > 10.000 lines of output in your RunOnceScheduler, we should not first append to the model and then trim but rather trim the string to 10.000 lines and then just set this to the model directly. 

I am trying to protect from the case where an extension might produce 1.000.000 lines of output and we would first just blindly set it to the model and only afterwards trim it.

data.title: Output: do not react to output events when panel is hidden or output channel not selected
data.body:
When the panel is closed or another output channel is selected or another panel (e.g. REPL), output events should not cause the output model to constantly work. Only when the output model is visible would I expect any work to be done.

Marking as important because it is possible that some extension constantly floods output into the system which can slow down other components.

data.title: launch occurs even if preLaunchTask fails

data.body: Having issues with double curly braces and text in between. Say `{{person.name}}`, VSCode won't let me place the cursor between the second opening curly braces and the p.

data.body: If the function is defined in another js file especially when in same directory, Visual Studio doesn't find it which is weird.

data.title: Show Git Output doesn't switch Output panel's drop-down to the Git option
data.body:
Clicking _Show Git Output_ does not switch the Output panel's drop-down list selection to the Git option.
## Reproduce
1. Go to the Git screen.
2. Make sure the Output panel is already visible and that _Tasks_ is the selected item in the drop-down.
3. Click the _Show Git Output_ option.
4. Note that _Tasks_ is still the selected item in the Output panel's drop-down.
## Screenshot

![vscode-show-git-output](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/72149/13623338/855aa308-e56b-11e5-88fa-5041e93ecc98.gif)
## App Version

```
Version 0.10.10
Commit 5b5f4db87c10345b9d5c8d0bed745bcad4533135
Date 2016-03-07T10:38:23.764Z
Shell 0.35.6
Renderer 45.0.2454.85
Node 4.1.1
```

data.title: Indentation breaks code folding
data.body:
I am using the latest version on Windows 7 Pro x64.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/290167/13622648/c1ccb5de-e565-11e5-937b-ab3e2d2fe9b5.png)

This may be by design, but a single-line code block cannot be collapsed.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/290167/13622492/a6196d10-e564-11e5-8e91-6ec333496578.png)

However, changing the indentation "allows" it.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/290167/13622309/63dabd24-e563-11e5-9fe0-7533bd104446.png)

But when I try to collapse it, it does this:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/290167/13622313/75507864-e563-11e5-879d-5d7ca2b760d1.png)

If I remove the single-line code block, things look as expected:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/290167/13622426/4c13678a-e564-11e5-9160-e578e19ce331.png)

Changing the indentation proves problematic, allowing me to collapse from the end brace:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/290167/13622450/6bda47aa-e564-11e5-982a-b9a50f316eb8.png)

Doing the collapse:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/290167/13622480/9201c0b6-e564-11e5-80c7-aa3a9c318d45.png)

I'm not sure if the language matters, but this is in a PHP file.

Thanks

data.title: Intellisense not displaying TypeScript autocomplete.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I upgraded to 0.10.10 this morning and immediately the TypeScript language support broke.

No squiggly hints for broken code, no Intellisense completion. I tried changing `intellisense.tsdk` along with a handful of typescript versions, but it didn't help.

Grasping at straws I set TSS_DEBUG and TSS_TRACE in my .bash_profile and all that got me was a notice that the TypeScript server had crashed. This suggests that VSCODE is indeed starting the TypeScript service and it is probably not failing (it worked in 0.10.9).

Downgrading fixed the issue for me for now, but I'd like to help diagnose the problem or find workarounds if possible. If someone could point me in the right direction for language service diagnostics I'd be happy to provide more feedback to help reproduce this issue.

OS: OS X 10.11.3 El Capitan
VSCode: 0.10.10
Typescript: Packaged with VSCode, 1.8.7, 1.9.0-dev.20160226
